block.p: Jennifer Beth Leffel, a daughter of Andrea and Elliot Leffel of Lawrence, N.Y., is to be married this evening to Andrew Jason Goldberg, a son of Judy and Irwin Goldberg of New City, N.Y. Rabbi Shalom Stern is to perform the ceremony at Temple Beth El in Cedarhurst, N.Y.

The bride, 25, was until last week the communications manager at the New York Organ Donor Network in Manhattan. Next month, she is to become a senior account executive at Rubinstein Associates, the public relations firm in Manhattan. She graduated from the State University at Binghamton, N.Y. Her father is the administrator of the Doc Care medical centers in Ridgewood, Queens, and Hauppauge, N.Y. Her mother is a saleswoman at the Jerry Shop, a women's clothing store in Cedarhurst.

Jennifer Beth Leffel, a daughter of Andrea and Elliot Leffel of Lawrence, N.Y., is to be married this evening to Andrew Jason Goldberg, a son of Judy and Irwin Goldberg of New City, N.Y. Rabbi Shalom Stern is to perform the ceremony at Temple Beth El in Cedarhurst, N.Y.

The bride, 25, was until last week the communications manager at the New York Organ Donor Network in Manhattan. Next month, she is to become a senior account executive at Rubinstein Associates, the public relations firm in Manhattan. She graduated from the State University at Binghamton, N.Y. Her father is the administrator of the Doc Care medical centers in Ridgewood, Queens, and Hauppauge, N.Y. Her mother is a saleswoman at the Jerry Shop, a women's clothing store in Cedarhurst.

The bridegroom, 26, is a stock trader at Knight Capital Markets in Purchase, N.Y. He graduated from Cornell University. His mother is a secretary at Blue Rill Day Camp in Monsey, N.Y. His father teaches science at Adlai E. Stevenson High School in the Bronx.
